intro: Obione × neomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico obione, is a hybrid plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Obione × neomexicana is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to arid environments.
